text: Limbella fryei, or Frye's limbella moss, is a species of moss in the family Amblystegiaceae. It is endemic to the United States. It is believed to occur in Oregon. As the species is threatened by habitat loss while only occurring in a very restricted area (less than 10 km2), it has been classified as critically endangered by the IUCN. ==References== ==See also== USDA Forest Service Species Fact Sheet Category:Hypnales Category:Endemic flora of the United States Category:Critically endangered plants Category:Bryophyta of North America Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Limbella fryei
